It is located in the [[Mile End, Montreal|Mile End]] neighbourhood of the borough of [[Le Plateau-Mont-Royal]] in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]] [http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m08.htm Laurier Metro Station]. The station opened on October 14, 1966, as part of the original network of the metro. == Overview == The metro station, designed by Jean P. Pothier, is a normal [[side platform]] station, built in [[tunnel]]. It has a [[Mezzanine (architecture)|mezzanine]] and an entrance at either end, the southern one incorporating an open sided [[bus shelter]], and the northern one including an automatic ticket barrier.
